@ownagesbot wrote:

When you are defining the String[] array, you initiate it then assign values. You do realise you can do it all in one like so:

String[] bla = { "thing at pos 0", "thing at pos 1", "thing at pos 2", "etc" };

item.title: Days of christmas
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

heres my code:

public class Bass {
public static void main(String[] args) {int pintsToDo = 1;
int loops = Integer.parseInt(args[0]);
int speed = 0;
try {
for(int l = 1; l <= loops; l++) {
System.out.println("On the "+num2word(""+l+"")+" day of Christmas my true love sent to me...");
if(l == 1) {
Thread.sleep(500-speed);
     System.out.println(" A pint of bass in a straight glass.");
} else if (l > 1) {
for(int i = pintsToDo; i > 0; i--) {
Thread.sleep(500-speed);
if(i == 1) {
System.out.println(makeSpaces(i, pintsToDo)+"and a pint of bass in a straight glass.");
  } else if(i > 1) {
System.out.println(makeSpaces(i, pintsToDo)+""+i+" pints of bass");
}}}
System.out.println();
   Thread.sleep(1500-speed);
pintsToDo++;
if((500-speed) > 30)
speed = speed + 15;
}}catch(InterruptedException ie) {
System.out.println("Interrupted while sleeping: " + ie);
}}
public static String num2word(String number) {
String[] suffixIndexes = new String[10];
suffixIndexes[0] = "3";
  suffixIndexes[1] = "0";
suffixIndexes[2] = "1";
suffixIndexes[3] = "2";
suffixIndexes[4] = "3";
suffixIndexes[5] = "3";
suffixIndexes[6] = "3";
suffixIndexes[7] = "3";
         suffixIndexes[8] = "3";
suffixIndexes[9] = "3";
String[] suffixes = new String[4];
suffixes[0] = "st";
   suffixes[1] = "nd";
suffixes[2] = "rd";
suffixes[3] = "th";
return number+suffixes[Integer.parseInt(suffixIndexes[Integer.parseInt(number.substring(number.length()-1, number.length()))])];
}
public static String makeSpaces(int pintNumber, int pintsToDo) {
int spaceCount = pintsToDo-pintNumber;
    String spaces = " ";
for(int i = 0; i < spaceCount; i++) {
spaces = spaces + " ";
}
return spaces;}}

actually i was just kidding, heres my code:

public class Bass {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        int pintsToDo = 1;
        int loops = Integer.parseInt(args[0]);
        int speed = 0;
        try {
            for(int l = 1; l <= loops; l++) {
                System.out.println("On the "+num2word(""+l+"")+" day of Christmas my true love sent to me...");
                if(l == 1) {
                    Thread.sleep(500-speed);
                    System.out.println(" A pint of bass in a straight glass.");
                } else if (l > 1) {
                    for(int i = pintsToDo; i > 0; i--) {
                        Thread.sleep(500-speed);
                        if(i == 1) {
                            System.out.println(makeSpaces(i, pintsToDo)+"and a pint of bass in a straight glass.");
                        } else if(i > 1) {
                            System.out.println(makeSpaces(i, pintsToDo)+""+i+" pints of bass");
                        }
                    }
                }
                System.out.println();
                Thread.sleep(1500-speed);
                pintsToDo++;
                if((500-speed) > 30)
                    speed = speed + 15;
            }
        } catch(InterruptedException ie) {
            System.out.println("Interrupted while sleeping: " + ie);
        }
    }
    public static String num2word(String number) {
        String[] suffixIndexes = { "3", "0", "1", "2", "3", "3", "3", "3", "3", "3" };
        String[] suffixes = { "st", "nd", "rd", "th" };
        return number+suffixes[Integer.parseInt(suffixIndexes[Integer.parseInt(number.substring(number.length()-1, number.length()))])];
    }
    public static String makeSpaces(int pintNumber, int pintsToDo) {
        int spaceCount = pintsToDo-pintNumber;
        String spaces = " ";
        for(int i = 0; i < spaceCount; i++) {
            spaces = spaces + " ";
        }
        return spaces;
    }
}

it gets pretty funky when you get to day 50 coz it speeds up (i know there arent 50 days to crimbo but i wanted to emphasize the awesomeness of it)

here are some batches if u cba to write urself but if ur on linux fku

@echo off
:loop
javac *.java
pause
cls
goto loop
@echo off
java Bass 50
pause

cc
